column4: hey all, can anyone help me.  There's a bug in Kopete to do with webcams, and i've found a bug fix, i'm just not sure how to compile it.
can anyone help me with compiling Kopete, or should i try in a KDE channel?
why would you like to do that??
just install the package
i can't, i need to edit the source, then compile
then it should be easy, just make sure you have kde*-dev packages installed
better yet, download ubuntu's kopete source package and modify
what package name would i be looking for? Kopete-sources?
apt-get source kopete AFAIR
now i've run the apt-get, where do i find the source packages?
in the current dir
then after modifying the src compile the new package
ok, assume i'm some kind of useless ape, what commands do i need to run to compile it now?
i don't remember, read the manual, man apt-get
so, have you found the command?
i have run configure
don't! compile the package not the source
wait
run "sudo dpkg-buildpackage" in the src directory
that's the right way to recompile the package after modification
does it work? i'm talking out of memory
do you run as root, sudo?
, you must be in the package directory
cdbs docbook-to-man kdelibs4-dev (>= 4:3.5.0) libgadu-dev libslp-dev automake1.9 libglib2.0-dev - those were the unmet build dependencies
